item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Trick Lets You Cheese Fights With Invisible Enemies
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Baldur's Gate 3 come up with a marker line trick to spot invisible enemies in battles easily.
  • Essentially, players select the character they want to move and then pan around the ground until the marker line finds an area that looks like it doesn't line up properly.
  • Another player offered a simpler solution to keybind the 'ping' button, then use the keybind on the invisible enemy's portrait in the initiative order.

Eagle-eyed Baldur's Gate 3 players have found a nifty trick that helps spot frustrating invisible enemies in battle by using a handy and simple tool. Released in August 2023, Baldur's Gate 3 is a fascinating fantasy RPG game that is based on the popular tabletop role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons, bringing the world of the tabletop game into the video game world.

Players are able to pick from several pre-designed Baldur's Gate 3 origin characters or simply create their own original character from the wide range of races and classes available. The game has won a host of awards, from Game of the Year and Best RPG to the Best Multiplayer Game, and has only continued to grow in size and popularity since then, thanks to continued content releases and updates from Larian Studios. One of the many reasons players love Baldur's Gate 3 so much is not only down to its incredible storylines and intricate characters, but also its combat mechanics, even though some encounters can be rather difficult.

On Reddit, helpful players have come up with a handy trick after noticing how difficult it can be to spot Baldur's Gate 3 's invisible enemies during battles. User BigBoiFloop explained that if players want to "cheese" sneaky hostiles who aren't showing up on the screen, all they have to do is select the character they want to move and then pan around the ground until the marker line finds an area that looks like it doesn't line up properly. This is where the invisible foe is hiding by taking up that particular space, allowing players to maneuver into this area and providing the perfect ambush by using an area-of-effect, or AOE, attack to reveal them.

Baldur's Gate 3 Players Provide Handy Trick to Cheese Invisible Enemies

In the post's comments, another Baldur's Gate 3 player offered an even simpler trick on how to spot invisible enemies. User Norkash stated that all players have to do is "keybind the 'ping' button, then use the keybind on the invisible enemy's portrait in the initiative order. It will ping their exact location even if they moved.” Many commenters in the thread were amazed at how easy it now was to spot invisible hostiles, having previously struggled with this frustrating combat element. One player said that they had used the simple keybind exploit to cheese the Auntie Ethel boss fight and had found it incredibly useful.

With Patch 7 bringing new cinematics for darker story paths, a dynamic split-screen mode, official modding tools, and more, Larian Studios continues its commitment to enhancing the player experience. Even though Baldur’s Gate 3 won’t receive a dedicated DLC, these frequent updates continue to provide players with countless reasons to pursue their adventures in Faerun.

item.title: Predecessor Codes (August 2024)
item.description:
Predecessor is an unusual MOBA with shooter elements featuring interesting lore and smooth gameplay. In Predecessor , avid strategists and shooter fans will have a lot of fun playing dynamic battles.

By redeeming Predecessor codes, you will receive nice rewards from developers offering valuable things. Although you won't get an advantage in matches, you can use the rewards to buy new cosmetic items to customize your favorite character and stand out from the crowd.

All Predecessor Codes

Working Predecessor Codes

At the moment, there are no expired Predecessor codes, but you can save this page to keep up to date and follow the new codes.

Expired Predecessor Codes

There are currently no expired Predecessor codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for Predecessor

Fortunately, just like in most mobile games, redeeming Predecessor codes is not difficult, but before you can do so, you will need to complete the tutorial, which will take about 10–15 minutes. Once you've done that and have access to the game interface, follow the next steps to claim your rewards:

  • Launch Predecessor .
  • Go to the main menu. Pay attention to the top-left corner of the screen. There will be several buttons arranged in a row. Among them, interact with the third one, which says Store.
  • After opening the Store, pay attention to the top section of the menu. Here, among the tabs, find and interact with the one that says Redeem.
  • This will open the redemption section. There will be an input field and a dark blue Redeem button below it. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the dark blue Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More Predecessor Codes

Just like with Roblox codes, to find more Predecessor freebies, be prepared to spend quite a bit of time monitoring a number of the game's official social media pages. From time to time, the developers share new codes here, so visit them regularly and be careful not to miss anything:

  • Official Predecessor TikTok account
  • Official Predecessor Discord server
  • Official Predecessor X account
  • Official Predecessor Facebook page
  • Official Predecessor Instagram account
  • Official Predecessor Twitch account
  • Official Predecessor Reddit

item.title: Crusader Kings 3: How To Slay A Dragon In The Game Of Thrones Mod
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Slay Wild Dragons In CK3 AGOT
  • How To Kill Dragons In War In CK3 AGOT
  • Dragon Vs Dragon Duels In CK3 AGOT

When it comes to the Game of Thrones mod for Crusader Kings 3 , players are usually more interested in taming and riding CK3 AGOT's dragons than slaying them. However, as soon as they want to play as a non-Dragonriding House, they will quickly realize that it's best to know how to kill them unless they are content under the yoke of the Targaryens.

Thankfully, there are a few ways to kill dragons in CK3 AGOT , although all options are just as dangerous and unreliable as the last. It's no joke; killing a dragon is extremely hard in the mod.

How To Slay Wild Dragons In CK3 AGOT

Wild dragons in CK3 AGOT are untamed and unowned by any owner of a Dragonpit. They will occasionally roam, flying to new areas , but typically they stay close to their starting location. A tamed dragon can become wild again if its rider dies, and it isn't held in a Dragonpit.

To find Wild Dragons, use the Manage Realm Affairs decision and select the Dragon option.

If players are intent on slaying these wild dragons, they will want to pin them , so that their location can be seen in the top-right corner. A wild dragon can only be slain when it flies into the player's land , where it will temporarily make a lair.

Gaining Dragonlore Knowledge In CK3 AGOT

Before players set out to slay a dragon in CK3 AGOT , they will want to obtain Dragonlore knowledge, as this will increase their chances of success. To do so, players will need to visit Sites of Draconic Significance, especially the Citadel .

  • The Citadel
  • The Field of Fire
  • Hill of Rhaenys in King's Landing
  • Dragonstone
  • Summerhall (If the tragedy has already happened)

The easiest way to do this is to plan a pilgrimage to Oldtown and alter your travel route to pass through these locations . Upon arriving, a simple event will pop up. Dragonlore is also crucial for hatching eggs in CK3 AGOT after all dragons have died out.

The Dragonslaying Event In CK3 AGOT

Once players have enough Dragonlore, and they have been alerted to the presence of a wild dragon in their lands, it's time to slay. To initiate this event, right-click on the dragon for the option. Upon doing so, players will be told that they have a chance to find the dragon's lair, a chance to find nothing, as well as a chance for the dragon to find them first.

Try to seek out smaller and weaker dragons who have a lower Combat Effectiveness.

If they are unable to find the dragon, they can try again in around a year if the dragon is still local . For those who find the dragon or are found by a dragon, the event will begin in earnest.

In the dragon duel event, players will be presented with the chances of being wounded, burned, and dying for each action. If they are able to survive a few of these rounds, they will eventually get options where there is a slim chance of slaying the dragon .

Don't be afraid to back out at any time! Seeking out a dragon is still great for roleplay in CK3.

Having a high Prowess score raises the odds of success , but even the greatest knights in Westeros history will always be more likely to die than slay a dragon. High Intrigue also means players might have the opportunity to poison their blade, and those with high Learning can attempt the use a storied mirror shield from the lore.

Ambushed By A Wild Dragon In CK3 AGOT

It is also possible to get ambushed by a dragon in CK3 AGOT while traveling through an area where a wild dragon has nested . This event triggers just like any other travel danger event, and it is usually best to plan trips away from a dragon's territory.

In the case of a dragon ambush, players will have a choice to fight or flee , although even when attempting to flee there is still a chance of death. Choosing to fight initiates the same dragon duel event as the one when players actively seek out a dragon to slay.

The Dragonslayer Trait In CK3 AGOT

If players manage to slay a dragon, they will be well rewarded with the Dragonslayer Trait and 'The Dragonslayer' nickname. They will also claim the dragon's skull as a prize. Unfortunately, the various bonuses from the skull can only be gained by displaying it in the Red Keep.

The Dragonslayer Trait not only provides Prowess , Prestige per month, Dread Gain , and General Opinion , but it also increases the odds of slaying another dragon in the future.

How To Kill Dragons In War In CK3 AGOT

A single brave warrior on a mission for instant glory is not the only way to kill a dragon in CK3 AGOT . Entire armies can attempt to do so in war. First of all, when a dragon is used in sieges , it is under increased threat . Nevertheless, it's not advisable to wish to be sieged by a dragon.

In battles, dragons always have a chance of being killed , and in CK3 this essentially comes down to luck. However, by specializing in Anti-Dragon Warfare, a realm's chances can be increased.

Anti-Dragon Warfare & Scorpions

Anti-Dragon Warfare is an Innovation that allows a culture to build Scorpions as Men-at-Arms units. Scorpions are purpose-built for bringing down dragons, making them essential for any side lacking these huge fiery beasts. The Innovation also allows players to build Scorpion Emplacements , where they can station their Scorpions to help them deal even more damage against dragons.

The Anti-Dragon Warfare Innovation is already unlocked by all Dornish cultures who, in the 82 AC & 106 AC start dates, have yet to join the fold of the Iron Throne. Other cultures will have to spend years researching the Innovation. In terms of using Scorpions, players will simply want to build lots of them and make sure they are in the army facing off against a dragon.

Dragon Vs Dragon Duels In CK3 AGOT

For those lucky enough to be a Dragonrider themselves, another way to kill dragons in war is to fly into battle and hope for a duel in the sky . Players will need to make sure they are part of the army in question, and they need to make sure they haven't disabled the use of their dragon in war .

In a battle with dragons on opposing sides, there is a small chance for the Enemy Dragonrider Spotted event to trigger. From here, players can elect to flee or fight . There's also a Sky Ambush event where the enemy dragon rider spots the player first.

Even if players attempt to flee, the opposing dragon and rider might chase them, initiating a fight.

The duel works similarly to standard duels in Crusader Kings 3 , with players choosing between options that can increase or decrease their chances of success. The options typically depend on the rider's Personality Traits, but success comes down to the Combat Effectiveness of the dragons and their personalities.

item.title: Roblox: Rarity Miner Codes (August 2024)
item.description:
Rarity Miner is a great miner simulator where you can dive into the deepest corners of the world to collect resources and ores. Here you will find a variety of unique mechanics, a flexible upgrade system, and enjoyable gameplay that significantly distinguishes Rarity Miner from other Roblox experiences.

By redeeming Rarity Miner codes, you can start progressing in the game much faster, as you will receive a bunch of useful rewards, from currency to rare ores. Each code has a specific expiration date, after which it becomes invalid and offers no rewards, so hurry up and don't miss out on freebies.

All Rarity Miner Codes

Working Rarity Miner Codes

  • vander, the enchant king - Redeem this code to get 15,000 Coins.
  • Harmony loves skibidi toilet - Redeem this code to get 15,000 Coins.
  • Randalladin loves skibidi toilet - Redeem this code to get 15,000 Coins.
  • Gurt - Redeem this code to get two Mercury Metal.
  • Wall20 - Redeem this code to get 20,000 Coins.
  • Hi Scoob! - Redeem this code to get Speed Enchant.
  • Berrel - Redeem this code to get Beryl Material.
  • Cheetos - Redeem this code to get two Flaming Enchant.
  • bugsbugsbugs - Redeem this code to get Medieval Torch Lantern.
  • Enchants2.0 - Redeem this code to get four Luck Enchants.
  • No Meters? - Redeem this code to get 2,000 Coins
  • Broken - Redeem this code to get Stupidity Lantern.
  • Banana - Redeem this code to get 25 Gold Ore.
  • Changelog - Redeem this code to get two Speed Enchant.
  • Hay - Redeem this code to get 25 Pyrit Oree.
  • Banner - Redeem this code to get 5,000 Coins.
  • Quest - Redeem this code to get 100 Coal Material.

Expired Rarity Miner Codes

There are currently no expired Rarity Miner codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for Rarity Miner

The system of redeeming Rarity Miner codes is not complicated, but it is not common in other Roblox experiences, so newcomers may not know how it works. To redeem rewards quickly and without any trouble, follow these instructions:

  • Launch Rarity Miner .
  • Go to the main lobby. From there, go down the stairs to the right of the mine pit.
  • Look to your right. There, you'll see several statues and a blue platform labeled Codes. Approach it and press the interact button.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a green Redeem button next to it. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the green Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification with a list of rewards above the input field.

How to Get More Rarity Miner Codes

Finding more Roblox codes is not difficult, but time-consuming, as it requires careful research on the game's official social media pages. There, the developers share codes from time to time, so by regularly visiting these pages, you can be one of the first to receive rewards:

  • Official Rarity Miner Roblox group.
  • Official Rarity Miner Discord server.
  • Official Rarity Miner X account.

item.title: What You Need To Know About PlayStation Plus
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All The PlayStation Plus Tiers
  • How Much Does PS Plus Cost?
  • How To Subscribe To PlayStation Plus?
  • What Is PS Plus On PC?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • PS Plus Essential Free Games For September 2024
  • What Games Are On PlayStation Plus Extra & Premium?
  • What Classics Are On PlayStation Plus Premium?
  • PS Plus Extra & Premium August 2024 New Games
  • Games Leaving PS Plus In August 2024
  • PS Plus Game Trials
  • Sony Pictures Core
  • Best Games By Genre
  • How PS Plus Works

Sony's PlayStation Plus is a well-known brand with a long history, but the service received a substantial makeover in 2022. Combining the original version with PS Now, the platform adopted a tiered system that seemed designed to offer something equivalent to Xbox Game Pass, with the higher levels containing extensive libraries of games that are updated monthly.

Although not without its controversies or criticisms, PS Plus has stabilized by this point, making it a consistently valid option for PS5 and even PS4 owners. As the service offers a lot of content along with different price points and features, here are the major things everyone should know about PS Plus.

Updated on August 29, 2024 by Mark Sammut: PS Plus Essential's September 2024 games have been revealed; consequently, that section has been updated to reflect this lineup. Also, the Extra and Premium games lists have been updated to reflect the August 2024 changes.

All The PlayStation Plus Tiers

Rather than present a one-size-fits-all subscription, PS Plus lets users have their pick from three tiers: Essential , Extra , and Premium . Here is a summary of each level's offerings:

  • Essential – The core PS Plus benefits as they were prior to the 2022 relaunch. Subscribers gain access to online multiplayer, monthly games, exclusive discounts, and a few other benefits.
  • Extra – Essential tier benefits + a catalog of downloadable PS5 and PS4 games.
  • Premium – Essential & Extra tiers benefits + a catalog of classic PS3, PS2, PS1, and PSP games.

Ultimately, picking a PS Plus tier comes down to someone's needs. If a player will only be using the online multiplayer feature, Essential will suffice and there is little to gain from subscribing to one of the higher tiers.

Premium's central selling is its Classics Catalog, which adds hundreds of titles on top of the PS5 and PS4 games that are also available in the Extra tier. While this collection is grand, please note that PS3 games are played through Cloud Streaming and cannot be downloaded. Consequently, their performance is dependent on the user's internet connection.

Which PS Plus Tier Should You Buy?

As there is quite a jump in price from one level to the next, a full breakdown of each tier's features and benefits might help someone decide whether they should go for Essential, Extra, or Premium.

Essential

Extra

Premium

Monthly Games

Yes

Yes

Yes

Online Multiplayer

Yes

Yes

Yes

Exclusive Discounts

Yes

Yes

Yes

Cloud Storage

Yes

Yes

Yes

Share Play

Yes

Yes

Yes

The PlayStation Plus Collection (PS5 Only)

Yes

Yes

Yes

Exclusive Content

Yes

Yes

Yes

Game Catalog – PS5 & PS4 Games

No

Yes

Yes

Ubisoft+ Classics

No

Yes

Yes

Classics Catalog – PS3, PS2, PS1, and PSP Games

No

No

Yes

Cloud Streaming

No

No

Yes

PS Plus on PC (Using Cloud Streaming)

No

No

Yes

Game Trials

No

No

Yes

Sony Pictures Catalogue/Sony Pictures Core

No

No

Yes

Crunchyroll Content (As Part of Sony Pictures Catalogue)

No

No

Yes

How Much Does PS Plus Cost?

Each PS Plus tier has its own price point to match the benefits included with the subscription.

PS Plus Essential

  • 1-Month Subscription: $9.99
  • 3-Month Subscription: $24.99
  • 12-Month Subscription: $79.99

PS Plus Extra

  • 1-Month Subscription: $14.99
  • 3-Month Subscription: $39.99
  • 12-Month Subscription: $134.99

PS Plus Premium

  • 1-Month Subscription: $17.99
  • 3-Month Subscription: $49.99
  • 12-Month Subscription: $159.99

How To Subscribe To PlayStation Plus?

The process to subscribe to PS Plus is quite straightforward, and there are a couple of avenues people can use to get there.

Newcomers to Sony's ecosystem will first need to create a PlayStation Network account as this is required to utilize any service, including buying games from the PS Store. An account by following this link.

How To Subscribe To PS Plus Using The PS5

The most convenient way to subscribe to PS Plus is through the PS5 or PS4 console.

  1. Log into the home screen.
  2. Navigate to the PlayStation Plus panel
  3. Select " Subscribe "
  4. Pick Essential, Extra, or Premium
  5. Pick a Payment Plan

How To Subscribe To PS Plus Using A Web Browser

It is also possible to subscribe to PS Plus directly from a web browser. Visit this playstation.com page and scroll down to the " Choose Your Membership Plan ." From there, choose a tier and select " Add to Cart ." After that, simply check out to complete the transaction.

How To Cancel A PS Plus Subscription?

There might come a time when someone might wish to cancel their PS Plus subscription. The process is quite uncomplicated:

  1. On a web browser, head to the Sony Network's Account Management page.
  2. From the menu's PlayStation Network options, select " Subscription ."
  3. Select " Cancel Subscription " near PlayStation Plus.

Account Management's Subscription page also allows players to change their PS Plus tiers or payment frequency.

What Is PS Plus On PC?

PS Plus Premium subscribers also have the option to stream games via the service's PC app. The library includes titles from both the Games and Classics Catalog, although it is not the full selection. Here are some things interested parties should know about this option:

  • The DualShock 4 is the only confirmed compatible controller . That does not mean other controllers will not work, just that they are not guaranteed by Sony.
  • PS Plus On PC is not currently available in every country that has the main streaming service.
  • PS5 games cannot be streamed.
  • A PS5 or PS4 is not needed to subscribe to PS Plus on PC.
  • Sony recommends a Broadband wired internet connection of a minimum of 5 Mbps ​​​​.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can PS Plus Premium Subscribers Stream PS5 Games?

PS Plus Premium's Cloud Streaming is compatible with the Games Catalog's PS4 games and all the titles found in the Classics Catalog. PS5 games cannot be streamed .

When Are New Games Added To PS Plus Premium & Extra?

Sony has not specified a fixed date of when subscribers can anticipate new additions to the library, but history suggests that games will be added roughly halfway through a month.

Can Subscribers Switch Tiers?

Yes. If someone wants to move up to a higher PS Plus tier, they only need to purchase a new membership at their desired level . This upgrade will happen instantly, and the customer will be charged a prorated fee for the rest of the current month.

If a member wishes to downgrade their tier, they would need to visit their Sony account's " Subscription " tab to perform the change. This alteration will come into effect once the next payment is made.

Can PS Plus Benefits Be Shared?

While limited to one PS5 or PS4 console, certain PS Plus benefits are shared among the different accounts on the system. These include online multiplayer, access to Premium & Extra's libraries, downloaded monthly games, and games purchased using a PS Plus discount .

Which PlayStation Plus should I Get?

Ultimately, this comes down to personal preference. If someone only intends to play PS5 and PS4 games, there is little reason to subscribe to Premium.

PS Plus Essential Free Games For September 2024

Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions (PS5/PS4); MLB The Show 24 (PS5/PS4); Little Nightmares 2 (PS5/PS4)

PS Plus Essential's September 2024 lineup is quite exciting, even if all three games are relatively niche. Putting personal preference aside, Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is undoubtedly the month's biggest name, mainly due to the fact it is a Day One arrival. Although not completely unheard of, PS Plus rarely goes down this route, so any exceptions are always exciting. Although not the first game to focus exclusively on the sport, Quidditch Champions could prove to be the definitive adaptation that delivers both single-player content in the form of a career and multiplayer support. Obviously, the latter is the main selling point, but the former should be good entertainment for a couple of hours. Players can take on four positions (Chasers, Beaters, Seekers, and Keepers), and they all come with nuances that should make them fun to learn.

Sticking with sports for now, September 2024 also includes MLB The Show 24 , an in-depth simulator that should be an easy recommendation to anyone remotely interested in baseball. Recently, PS Plus has given away sports games monthly, a process that can get frustrating if someone is not into the genre; however, MLB The Show is not a particularly common pick, and it is comfortably among the most consistent franchises on the market. Consequently, this is still an exciting addition to Essential.

Finally, Little Nightmares 2 is a fantastic puzzle-platformer that can be completed in a couple of hours. While not as scary as some other horror games, the project is packed with creepy monster designs, along with a tense and discomforting atmosphere that lasts throughout the whole campaign. While not offering as much longevity as September 2024's other PS Plus games, Little Nightmares 2 is undeniably quality. Its sequel is also on the horizon.

PS Plus Essential's September 2024 games will be available to download from September 3 to September 30.

What Games Are On PlayStation Plus Extra & Premium?

  • Current as of August 29, 2024

Most subscribers will likely invest in PS Plus Extra as that tier contains more than enough PS5 and PS4 games to keep someone busy for a long time. Unless specifically interested in classic PS games or Cloud Streaming, there is not much reason to pick Premium over Extra. Still, subscribers of both tiers can download and install the following titles.

PS Plus' game library can vary from country to country.

Every PS5 Game On PS Plus Extra & Premium

What Classics Are On PlayStation Plus Premium?

PS Plus Premium celebrates PlayStation's past, bringing together titles released over the span of more than two decades. If a PS5 or PS4 owner wants to play some old favorites, this tier should deliver.

PS Plus Extra & Premium August 2024 New Games

The Witcher 3, Sword Art Online, & TimeSplitters

Extra & Premium

Premium Only

August 20, 2024

  • Cult of the Lamb (PS5/PS4)
  • Naruto to Boruto: Shinobi Striker (PS4)
  • Ride 5 (PS5)
  • Sword Art Online: Alicization Lycoris (PS4)
  • Sword Art Online: Fatal Bullet (PS4)
  • Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization (PS4)
  • Sword Art Online: Last Recollection (PS5/PS4)
  • The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt (PS5/PS4)
  • Watch Dogs 2 (PS4)
  • Wild Hearts (PS5)

  • Sword Art Online: Lost Song (PS4)
  • TimeSplitters (PS2)
  • TimeSplitters 2 (PS2)
  • TimeSplitters: Future Perfect (PS2)
  • Vacation Simulator (PS VR2)

PlayStation Plus has quite a stacked lineup for August 2024 for both the Extra and Premium tiers. The former is headlined by The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt , CD Projekt Red's beloved open-world RPG that is gradually approaching its 10-year anniversary. Due to its rampant popularity, The Witcher 3 might not be "new" to most people; however, it is hard to complain about one of the greatest games of all time.

Those who have already played through the RPG can turn to August's other arrivals to see if anything fits their fancy. Cult of the Lamb is a pretty big deal in its own right. The quirky and comically dark roguelike has rightfully amassed a very positive reception, and it plays well on consoles. EA's Wild Hearts is also an interesting arrival, especially since it is one of those games that some people might struggle to justify purchasing.

The game lineup contains five Sword Art Online projects, with one being exclusive to the Premium tier. These games are primarily for die-hard fans of the source material, but if somebody is into SAO but has so far avoided its RPGs, they now have easy access to nearly all of them.

August 2024's PS Plus lineup's highlight is arguably TimeSplitters , with the PS2 trilogy arriving in full on the Premium tier. Free Radical Design's FPS series is all-around fantastic and has aged pretty well, making them fun to revisit even all these years after their debuts.

Games Leaving PS Plus In August 2024

NBA 2K24, Need For Speed Unbound, & More

Subscription Tiers

Games

Departure Dates

Extra & Premium

  • Destroy All Humans 2: Reprobed
  • Lost Judgment
  • Midnight Fight Express
  • Moving Out 2
  • NBA 2K24
  • Need For Speed Unbound
  • Sea of Stars
  • SpellForce 3 Reforced
  • Trials of Mana

August 20, 2024

Premium

  • Destroy All Humans!

August 20, 2024

While initially seeming like a small list of departures, August 2024 will have more games leaving PS Plus Extra than expected. The lineup includes some fairly major names as well, and they are mostly on the long side, meaning they will be difficult to complete before they depart from Sony's subscription service.

Although not for everyone, NBA 2K24 is a huge deal regardless. Considering 2K plans to release NBA 2K25 at the beginning of September 2024, its predecessor's withdrawal from PS Plus Extra makes sense to an extent. After all, why provide extra competition by presenting subscribers with a similar game they can access for free? August 20 will also see another polarizing title leave PS Plus: Need for Speed Unbound . EA's racing franchise has been divisive for most of the last decade, and that remained the case with the 2022 entry. As far as open-world racers are concerned, Unbound is a perfectly enjoyable arcade-leaning option, and its anime-style splashes add a ton of personality.

This month is set to be particularly cruel for RPG fans, with Sea of Stars and Trials of Mana both saying goodbye to PS Plus. The former delivers an impressive turn-based adventure inspired by classic JRPGs; meanwhile, the latter is a remake of a 1995 JRPG classic. Visions of Mana is debuting on August 29, 2024, so that might be why one of its predecessors is leaving PS Plus. SpellForce 3 Reforced is also departing, ensuring strategy RPG fans do not feel left out.

Lost Judgment is also ending its run on PS Plus, which is a significant loss for anyone remotely interested in Yakuza / Like a Dragon . The spin-off series is great, and the sequel is arguably even better than its predecessor. Moving Out 2 , Destroy All Humans , and Midnight Fight Express are also leaving the service.

PS Plus Game Trials

Besides instant access to PS Plus's Game and Classics Catalogs, Premium subscribers can also try out a select few PS5 and PS4 titles for a limited time. Players can currently test out more than 60 games, and their trial periods vary in length.

Check out the below article to see the full PS Plus Premium game trials list.

Sony Pictures Core

A little-known feature available to Premium subscribers, Sony Pictures Core is a steaming service that contains over 2000 movies that can be rented or bought. Anyone can create an account, but people who have a Premium subscription have access to a range of movies.

Most of the biggest recent titles will need to be purchased, but the selection has a couple of older titles that can keep someone entertained for a few hours when they do not feel like playing a game. The Sony Pictures Catalogue also includes anime content from Crunchyroll.
